alert.note: Alert for Somerset; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 3:59PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Somerset and south central Wicomico Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 358 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Salisbury University. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Somerset and south central Wicomico Counties, including the following locations... Catchpenny, Trinity, Salisbury-Wicomico, Chesapeake Heights, Eden, Shad Point, Allen and Lakewood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
